reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything good that others have said about this hotel and the staff is true. The famous Uta sent an email before we arrived and was on hand to welcome us, show us the room and generally make sure we got to see the best of the city. The room was extremely sylish, with really high-quality fittings and a big luxurious bathroom. The hotel is two minutes walk from a charming square where there are bars and restaurants, and in twenty minutes you can walk up the elegant cobbled streets to the Alta Citta.
reviews.title: Excellent, stylish and welcoming in a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Uta gave us great advice on where to go for dinner and to buy wine, and even had the business cards of both places in her desk so we knew where to go.
reviews.title: Look no further...

reviews.text: Breakfast was good, fine fresh fruit and a good selection of other tasty cereals, yoghurts, pastries, etc.
reviews.title: design boutique hotel, exactly where it should be!

reviews.text: Bergamo is a super charming city. Even the dogs are elegant and look like they are having a grand and rather stylish time. One of the very few hotels that would encourage me to return just to stay there again.
reviews.title: Just Perfect!
Excellent!
reviews.text: A genuinely welcoming and relaxing boutique hotel, with classy contemporary rooms and a great line in breakfasts. With only 12 rooms the friendly service was great, be it booking us into restaurants, loaning a map of Milan, checking the airlines were running in the snow, or even tracking down a lost jumper and posting it back to the UK! The location was quiet but with restaurants and shops around the corner. It was a pleasant 15 minute walk from the funicular up to the Old Town, and similarly 15 mins from train station. A great place to spend a weekend, and thoroughly enjoyed.

We had a very nice stay in this hotel. You get a warm welcome, the rooms are original and modern. Bathroom with nice shower. Perhaps ask a room at heigher level or backside, because at night it can be some noisy on the street in front. The breakfast is original with fresh fruit juice, fresh fruit, and realy a nice choice of ....nice things :-) We also arrived late from our restaurant at the hotel, and the person in the hotel served us still a nice drink at the bar with the smile !! So when I come back in Bergamo, I certainly will stay at this hotel ! And the location is perfect at the city centre.
reviews.title: Modern style, very friendly service, new rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel looks nothing from the outside but certainly makes up for it inside. We only stayed here for 1 night - which makes me want to go back for longer to enjoy the experience all over again. The staff are so lovely and helpful - if you want to know where to go for a delicious dinner just ask at reception. We had spent 4 nights in Milan but the best meal we had by far was the meal in Bergamo, the fact that it was also the cheapest was an added bonus. This is a beautiful city - I would definitely recommend that you walk up the steep hill to the old city and enjoy the atmosphere and views. There are lovely restaurants and bars in the square for you to relax and indulge yourself with some wine or beer! Back to the hotel - the rooms are lovely, all mod cons at your fingertips. It is a very quiet hotel, we had a night cap in the garden which was lovely. Breakfast was delicious with a great selection of fresh fruits, yoghurts, cold meats, cheeses, smoked salmon, freshly ground coffee - what more could you possibly want? I would highly recommend this hotel - when I go back to Milan I would stay here the whole time and commute to Milan city to do the sightseeing stuff. Bergamo is far more beautiful - I can't wait to go back :-)
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel

reviews.text: My daughter and I spent two nights in the Petronilla hotel. We booked a twin room, we got one on the 3rd floor with a view of the buildings opposite. The hotel is situated a little out of the way for most of the good restaurants ( although v close to Al Vecchio Tagliare which is excellent) and close to the shopping streets in the Citta Bassa. The room was very clean and well appointed with a lovely bathroom with rain water shower. Breakfast was very good with fresh fruit, lots of good juice and coffee and the usual prosciutto and cheese, fresh bread and an assortment of cakes. The staff were very helpful and friendly. So why a little disappointed? Well I thought the room was overpriced at €210 per night, I prefer to stay near the Citta Alta when in Bergamo, the hot tub and sauna were not in service ( I didn't ask why but I expect it was because the hotel was not busy) and we have stayed in about 14 hotels / apartments in Bergamo and the Petronilla would not be in my top 3. For the record we love love love La Valletta and the Gombit is perfectly located and a nice place to stay for the Citta Alta and San Vigilio. The San Marco is conveniently located for both the Citta Alta and Bassa and is great value off season at our rate of €120 per night for a superior 7th floor room with balcony and wonderful view of the Citta Alta.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but a little overrated?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Uta , the manager, was wonderful from beginning to end. She gave us very clear driving directions and we were able to park right in front of the hotel at no cost. The hotel is located about a 20 minute walk from the funicular going to the Citta' Alta ( easy walk and necessary after eating all the good food!) and right around the corner from fabulous shopping. It's a great locatin to see both Bergamot and the surrounding areas. Rooms were quiet even with windows open. Bathrooms are quite large and beautiful. Bed was very comfortable. Decor is contemporary. Oh, and the breakfast is delicious! Loved the homemade yogurt. We stayed 3 nights and we would definitely come back.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the Petronilla hotel, there is a great personal welcome by all the personell. From the welcoming receptionist till the great waiter at the breakfast, we loved it.
reviews.title: very nice, beautiful hotel with personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable, chic, friendly, helpful and quiet. We had a wonderful weekend. The rooms are relatively simple but elegant. The staff give the place a friendly family feel. They were very helpful in recommending places to go and to eat and drink. Getting here by car was relatively easy and they will park the car for you at no extra cost. The main shopping is nearby and there are lots of bars, cafes and restaurants nearby. Breakfast was a nice selection of fruit, yogurts and cakes and on a warm day the tables out in the courtyard are lovely.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Made to feel very welcome and the team were all most helpful and very attentive. Modern and comfortable bedroom. Breakfast was delicious with plenty of choice.Uta's apple strudel ( yes for breakfast!) simply delicious! Great location just minutes from the main shopping area and a good 25 minute brisk walk to Bergamo Alta with a choice of restaurants. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kudos to Uta and staff for providing the highest quality of hospitality while visiting area. From the moment you arrive the staff dote on you allowing total relaxation and appreciation of the area. Uta greeted us with a HUGE smile and took us to our room where she showed us everything to be comfortable. Uta was spot on for all the restaurants she referred us to take part in dining. They were spectacular!! In regard to attractions, Uta gave us the details and excellent in marking on map with directions. Rooms were great, clean, modern, and inviting. We returned from dinner with a tray of apertifs and handwritten note from Uta and staff. Breakfast was beyond expectations with fresh fruit, biscuits, and the usual Italian morning fare. Bergamo is a wonderful city to discover and next time we will plan more time and definitely return to the best B & B there.....Petronilla!!
reviews.title: If you could give ten stars I would......FANTASTIC place..DO NOT MISS!

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left Uta and her team did everything she could to make our stay special and memorable. The room was simply stylish with a large bathroom, fluffy bathrobes and rain shower effect shower. An inviting tray of biscuits and a welcome note awaited us in the double room. Uta made fabulous recommendations for making the most of a glorious spring day - and only a couple of hours after we had arrived we were soaking in the view and a glass of prosecco at a fabulous pizza restaurant at the very top of the city! The rest of the day was spent meandering around the beautiful lanes and peering into wonderful churches in the old city. a leisurely walk back to the hotel prepared us for a delicious dinner back at the hotel. Day two we ventured by train to Lake Como - pretty but the scenery not at it's best due to the overhanging cloud. Uta booked a terrific dinner for us in the main square of Bergamo - food was beautifully presented. Umbrellas, maps, friendly advice on how to make the best of our short stay were key to a successful visit. Hope to comeback and stay again soon!
reviews.title: Simply Superb

reviews.text: this is a true gem of good service and good taste in the middle of a fascinating city. We were personally welcomed, a restaurant was booked for us -just in case- and the following morning a delicious breakfast was served in delightful room, we all had double helpings and almost missed our train, we should have stayed on one more day!
reviews.title: do not miss it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is wonderful and I almost didn't want to write a review because I don't want crowds to storm it.
reviews.title: Could not be any better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Uta is the manager. She is wonderful. made great recommendations, upgraded us to a better room, just because it was available.
reviews.title: Okay, amazing just does not do this hotel justice!

reviews.text: The room was very spacious, clean. The bed was comfortable. The shower had different settings.
reviews.title: Short Stay in Bergamo

reviews.title: Bergamo = Hotel Petronilla
